meanings.definition: To remove hydrogen from a compound.
meanings.sent1: Scientists dehydrogenate the molecule to study its structure.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the compound will dehydrogenate to form a new product.
meanings.sent3: The chemical decided to dehydrogenate itself for a change of pace.
meanings.sent4: The process of dehydrogenating the compound revealed its hidden properties.
meanings.sent5: The lab assistant carefully dehydrogenated the solution under controlled conditions.

meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical reaction in which hydrogen is removed.
meanings.sent1: When exposed to heat, the substance will dehydrogenate and release gas.
meanings.sent2: Certain compounds dehydrogenate naturally when exposed to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The hydrogen atoms were surprised when they were dehydrogenated so suddenly.
meanings.sent4: The chemical reaction proceeded smoothly, dehydrogenating the compound effectively.
meanings.sent5: The plant extract will dehydrogenate when mixed with the catalyst.

meanings.definition: To cause a substance to lose hydrogen.
meanings.sent1: The strong acid can dehydrogenate the metal, changing its properties.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the environment can dehydrogenate the organic material.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dehydrogenated the sauce, giving it a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The chemical reaction will dehydrogenate the compound, altering its composition.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight exposure can dehydrogenate the plastic, making it brittle.
